text:
Uniontown is a city in Bourbon County, Kansas, United States. In 2010, 272 people lived there.
History.
A post office was created in 1856 about two miles east of the town. Uniontown was moved to its current place around 1865. The early settlers were loyal to the Union in the Civil War. The city was named after the Union. Throughout the twentieth century the town was served by the Missouri Pacific Railroad.
Geography.
Uniontown is at (37.847264, -94.975922). It is along the Marmaton River. The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of. All of it is land.
2010 census.
The 2010 census says that there were 272 people, 120 households, and 66 families living in Uniontown.
